title: 110_hr6984
content: The Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act of 2008, Part II extends fuel and ticket taxes funding the Airport and Airway Trust Fund until March 31, 2009. The effective date for these amendments is October 1, 2008. Additionally, the Act extends the expenditure authority of the Airport and Airway Trust Fund. The Authority amends the Internal Revenue Code to change dates and include the Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act of 2008. The Airport Improvement Program is extended with authorization of appropriations under title 49, United States Code. The Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act of 2008 authorizes $1,950,000,000 for a 6-month period starting on October 1, 2008. The funds can be used until September 30, 2009, and the Administrator of the FAA will adjust funding calculations accordingly. The Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act of 2008 authorizes a reduction of 50 percent in funding apportionments and amounts available for certain sections. Various authorities are extended until March 31, 2009, or April 1, 2009, depending on the specific section. The Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act of 2008 extends various authorities until March 31 or April 1, 2009, by amending specific sections of the act. The Federal Aviation Administration Extension Act of 2008 extends authorities until April 1, 2009, by amending specific sections related to FAA operations and air navigation facilities and equipment. SEC. 8. RESEARCH, ENGINEERING, AND DEVELOPMENT. Section 48102(a) of title 49, United States Code, is amended to allocate $85,507,500 for the 6-month period starting on October 1, 2008.
